[{"id":"fT6uH4Ar7K","type":"header","data":{"text":"ELA","col":12}},{"id":"r9TBisLQea","type":"card","data":{"card_name":"Configuration","col":5}},{"id":"565SdPbMiN","type":"header","data":{"text":"Usage","col":12}},{"id":"BBag-QLdDV","type":"paragraph","data":{"text":"1. Setup a learning space (example: a school)
2. Create at least one learning cohort associated with the learning space
3. Upload learners for each cohort
4. Create activities
5. Create entries for teachers (all the teachers who are likely to use ELA in the learning space)
6. Create assessment forms - one each for a cohort + activity
7. Export the assessment form as a file. This 'form file' will be used by the ELA Collect mobile app.
8. Transfer it to the phone device via Bluetooth (link to steps - TBC)
9.  Ensure the form file is in the location Dowload/ela/forms
10. Open the ELA Collect app (scan QR code step - TBC)
11. Click on 'Download Form'. This will load your form from the location Download/ela/form into the app
12. Click on 'Start new form' and submit forms as usual.","col":12}},{"id":"OJ9kE1HHGO","type":"header","data":{"text":"Prerequisites","col":12}},{"id":"HPBWP55naS","type":"paragraph","data":{"text":"1. A smartphone with the ELA Collect app installed
2. A desktop computer with the ELA server app installed and pre-configured. Collect the user id and password from the administrator
3. Configure the 'ELA local' project by scanning this QR code in the ELA Collect app. This is a one-time task. DO NOT DELETE THIS PROJECT once you have started submitting forms. Otherwise you will lose all the collected data.
4. Understand key terminology - Cohort, Learner, Activity, Assessment Form, Submission, Package
","col":12}}]
